intro: Dyssodia pentachaeta subsp. hartwegii, commonly known as the Hartweg's dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in rocky soils and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
